titles.title: Racial Profiling Prohibition Act of 2001

To amend title 23, United States Code, to require States to adopt and enforce standards that prohibit the use of racial profiling in the enforcement of State laws regulating the use of Federal-aid highways.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Highways and Transit.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 3/8/2001--Introduced. Racial Profiling Prohibition Act of 2001 - Directs the Secretary of Transportation to withhold specified Federal highway fund apportionments for a State that fails to adopt and enforce standards that prohibit the use of racial profiling in the enforcement of State laws regulating the use of Federal-aid highways.
